sentences: Tema ei ole veel lugenud oma sõnumit.
context: The word 'sõnumit' is the partitive case form of the Estonian noun 'sõnum', which means 'message'. In Estonian, nouns change their endings based on grammatical cases. The partitive case (-t ending) is often used to indicate an object that is being acted upon or exists in some quantity. So 'sõnumit' would translate to '(a) message' or '(some) messages' depending on the context.
